revised_title: Establishing a Standard for Measuring Photochemical Action
tldr: Bunsen and Roscoe developed a method to measure the chemical action of light and established a standard for comparing the chemical action of sunlight. They investigated the distribution of chemical activity on Earth's surface and determined the chemical brightness of different portions of the sky. This research laid the foundation for a new branch of meteorological science, studying the chemical climate and the effects of solar rays on Earth.
